meanings.definition: Cheat or swindle (someone) by trickery or deception.
meanings.sent1: The con artist thimblerigged the unsuspecting tourists out of their money.
meanings.sent2: He thimblerigged his way into getting a free meal at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The magician thimblerigged the audience into believing he made the coin disappear.
meanings.sent4: She thimblerigged her opponents with her quick moves on the chessboard.
meanings.sent5: The scammer thimblerigged the old lady by pretending to fix her roof but running off with her savings instead.

meanings.definition: Engage in the game of thimblerig.
meanings.sent1: During the fair, many people gathered to watch the street performer thimblerigged with cups and a pea.
meanings.sent2: The children loved to thimblerig with their friends during recess.
meanings.sent3: The siblings decided to thimblerig to see who would do the dishes after dinner.
meanings.sent4: In the park, a group of friends thimblerigged for fun, trying to guess where the ball was hidden.
meanings.sent5: The students thimblerigged during their break, laughing and enjoying the game together.

meanings.definition: Deceive or trick (someone) by using sleight of hand.
meanings.sent1: The street magician thimblerigged the crowd with his card tricks.
meanings.sent2: She thimblerigged her brother by making a coin disappear and reappear behind his ear.
meanings.sent3: The pickpocket thimblerigged the distracted man by stealing his wallet without him noticing.
meanings.sent4: The illusionist thimblerigged the judges with his mind-bending performance.
meanings.sent5: The con artist thimblerigged the audience by making them believe he could read minds.
